meanings.definition: Making a low sound of pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The injured dog was moaning softly in the corner.
meanings.sent2: She woke up in the middle of the night to hear her baby moaning in his sleep.
meanings.sent3: The old floorboards were moaning under the weight of the heavy furniture.
meanings.sent4: The wind moaning through the trees created an eerie atmosphere in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house seemed to be moaning with unseen spirits.

meanings.sent1: The moaning customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent2: She was tired of her moaning coworker always finding something to complain about.
meanings.sent3: The moaning child at the store made everyone smile with his cute complaints.
meanings.sent4: The moaning cat looked at its empty food bowl with a dissatisfied expression.
meanings.sent5: The moaning teenager's constant complaints were starting to wear on her parents.

meanings.sent1: The moaning turtle made its way across the sandy beach.
meanings.sent2: The moaning truck struggled up the steep hill with its heavy load.
meanings.sent3: The moaning snail inched along the garden path at a leisurely pace.
meanings.sent4: The moaning glacier crept forward imperceptibly over the centuries.
meanings.sent5: The moaning sloth lazily climbed the tree, taking its time with each movement.
